series_description: This series documents the history of an offender while in Dept. of Corrections custody, to include pre-sentencing, sentencing, screening, classification, adjustments, legal status, chain of custody, incidents, offender discipline, programs, and parole. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports, correspondence, orders, logs, photographs, receipts, forms, summonses, warrants, and audio/visual recordings.

This series documents the request, justification, and authorization for amendments made to an offender’s incarceration record concerning charges or offenses of which the offender was eventually found not guilty. This series may include, but is not limited to: forms, memos, and correspondence.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the history of an executed offender in Dept. of Corrections (DOC) custody, including the execution by the DOC and the death-row activities of the offender, and visitors. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports, correspondence, orders, logs, photographs, receipts, forms, summonses, warrants, and audio/visual recordings.

This series documents offenders’ incarceration history and series on microfilm being stored as a non-permanent record at the State Records Center until DOC personnel can review the film for content and appropriately classify the potential multiple series contained therein. This series may include, but is not limited to: incarceration and medical records.
retention_statement: 50 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the healthcare services provided to and received by individual offenders while physically incarcerated the DOC. This series includes, but is not limited to: reports, forms, tests, x-rays, images, correspondence, notes, and orders.
